duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide physical therapy services to adults and pediatrics, conducting comprehensive assessments and developing tailored treatment plans.
Utilize broad-based clinical experience in multiple settings to deliver high-quality rehabilitation therapy.
Continuously develop clinical knowledge and skills through ongoing education and training to enhance patient outcomes.
Lead and mentor a team of rehabilitation specialists, fostering collaboration and guiding their efforts towards providing exceptional patient care.
Contribute to the development and implementation of healthcare management strategies to optimize patient care and clinical operations.

education_certification.credential: Master’s or Doctorate degree in Physical Therapy from an accredited program OR Graduate from an APTA approved program of Physical Therapy at the master's or bachelor’s level with 2 years proven work and Continuing Education experience that indicates applicant has mastered the knowledge base that would typically be taught in a Doctorate program - required
Licensed as a Physical Therapist - required
Current Basic Life Support certification - required
Broad-based clinical experience in multiple settings - preferred.
